snippet: Cornerstone Research recently found that the number of court-approved settlements of securities class-action suits fell in 2011 to the lowest level in more than a decade. Two lawyers, Daniel Tyukody and Gerald Silk, discuss the study's significance.
abstract: Cornerstone Research recently found that the number of court-approved settlements of securities class-action suits fell in 2011 to the lowest level in more than a decade. Two lawyers, Daniel Tyukody and Gerald Silk, discuss the study's significance.

byline.original: By DANIEL TYUKODY and GERALD SILK

headline.main: Understanding the Dip in Class-Action Securities Settlements
